  • Package <Unnamed>

    • Class Pong3d1pControl extends java.applet.Applet implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • go

          java.awt.Button go
          The button which will start a new game of pong

        • ballTrans

          javax.media.j3d.TransformGroup ballTrans
          The transform group which will determine the placement of the ball in the universe

        • humanTrans

          javax.media.j3d.TransformGroup humanTrans
          The transform group which will determine the placement of the human paddle in the universe

        • computerTrans

          javax.media.j3d.TransformGroup computerTrans
          The transform group which will determine the placement of the computer paddle in the universe

        • bTrans

          javax.media.j3d.Transform3D bTrans
          The transform 3d which act as the coordinates to where the ball will be placed, gets added to the TransformGroup

        • hTrans

          javax.media.j3d.Transform3D hTrans
          The transform 3d which act as the coordinates to where the human paddle will be placed, gets added to the TransformGroup

        • cTrans

          javax.media.j3d.Transform3D cTrans
          The transform 3d which act as the coordinates to where the computer paddle will be placed, gets added to the TransformGroup

        • depth

          float depth
          A float representing the z axis placement of the ball

        • sign

          float sign
          A float representing which direction along the y axis the ball is traveling

        • dir

          float dir
          A float representing which direction along the x axis the ball is traveling

        • timer

          javax.swing.Timer timer
          The timer used to continuously call the functions to simulate the game

        • xloc

          float xloc
          A float representing the x location of the ball

        • hxloc

          float hxloc
          A float representiong the x location of the human paddle

        • ground

          float ground
          A float representing the point of reference where the bottom of the universe will appear to be

        • xMAX

          float xMAX
          A float representing the bounds of how far left or right the universe extends to

        • squish

          double squish
          A double representing how much the ball "squishes" or x axis gets pinched when coliding

        • bCoords

          Coordinates bCoords
          Coordinates used for the ball when calculating next placement of all pong components

        • hCoords

          Coordinates hCoords
          Coordinates used for the human paddle when calculating next placement of all pong components

        • cCoords

          Coordinates cCoords
          Coordinates used for the computer paddle when calculating next placement of all pong components

        • cLogic

          Pong3d1pComputer cLogic
          Pong3d1pComputer used for determining the computer paddle AI logic

        • bLogic

          Pong3d1pBall bLogic
          Pong3d1pBall used for determining the ball logic

        • size

          int size
          Int representing the size of how many coordinate components are used in each ball logic calculation

        • bBounce

          float[] bBounce
          An array of floats of size size representing each of the different components used in the ball logic calculation

        • z

          float z
          A float representing the z coordinate of the human paddle

        • computerZ

          float computerZ
          A float representing the z coordinate of the computer paddle

        • computerX

          float computerX
          A float representing the x coordinate of the computer paddle

        • isDelayed

          boolean isDelayed
          A boolean representing if the game has been delayed because a point has been scored

        • humanScore

          int humanScore
          An int representing the current score of the human

        • computerScore

          int computerScore
          An int representing the current score of the computer

        • gameGoing

          boolean gameGoing
          A boolean representing whether or not a game is taking place right now

        • compPoints

          com.sun.j3d.utils.geometry.Sphere[] compPoints
          An array of spheres that represent the "lives left" of the human

        • humanPoints

          com.sun.j3d.utils.geometry.Sphere[] humanPoints
          An array of spheres that coordinate with the "lives left" of the computer

        • cpTrans

          javax.media.j3d.Transform3D[] cpTrans
          The transform 3d which act as the coordinates to where the "human lives" will be left

        • hpTrans

          javax.media.j3d.Transform3D[] hpTrans
          The transform 3d which acts as the coordinates to where the "computer lives" will be left

        • gameCount

          int gameCount
          An int representing the counter for number of games played

        • panel

          java.awt.Panel panel
          Panel to hold the new game button and message display

        • winner

          java.awt.Label winner
          label to act as a message display when you win or lose the game

    • Class ShootySnakeGame extends javax.swing.JFrame implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • KEYS

          boolean[] KEYS
          Will contain Boolean values returning true if the keys, whose Constant Field Values correspond to the index of this array, are pressed.

        • BALLS

          int BALLS
          The total number of enemy balls.

        • BEAMS

          int BEAMS
          The maximum number of beams.

        • BALL_SIZE

          double BALL_SIZE
          Diameter of the enemy balls.

        • BEAM_SIZE

          double BEAM_SIZE
          Diameter of the beam balls.

        • PLAYER_SIZE

          double PLAYER_SIZE
          Diameter of the player ball.

        • BALL_VELOCITY

          double BALL_VELOCITY
          How fast the balls move.

        • DIV

          double DIV
          Controls the tightness of the chain. 1 is the tightest. Higher is loose.

        • PLAYER_VELOCITY

          double PLAYER_VELOCITY
          How fast the player moves.

        • panel

          javax.swing.JPanel panel
          JPanel containing the Image image.

        • image

          java.awt.Image image
          Image containing the game graphics.

        • imageGraphics

          java.awt.Graphics imageGraphics
          Contains the graphics of the game.

        • chain

          ShootySnakeChain[] chain
          Ball array containing all the enemy balls.

        • beams

          ShootySnakeBall[] beams
          Ball array containing all of the beam Ball objects.

        • player

          ShootySnakeBall player
          The player Ball object.

        • lastShot

          long lastShot
          Contains the last nano second (according to nanoTime()) that a beam was fired.

        • spawnInvulnerabilityCounter

          long spawnInvulnerabilityCounter
          The length of time the player should be invulnerable to harm and can't shoot beams after spawning.

        • respawnStart

          long respawnStart
          Contains the nano second (according to nanoTime()) since a player respawned.

        • levelTransitionStart

          long levelTransitionStart
          Contains the nano second (according to nanoTime()) since the level transition period began.

        • lives

          int lives
          The number of lives the player has left before they lose. Getting struck by an enemy ball when the player has 0 will cause them to lose.

        • gameOver

          java.lang.Boolean gameOver
          The gameOver flag tells the game to stop updating the game model and to place the corresponding win/lose message in the window.

        • playerWon

          java.lang.Boolean playerWon
          The playerWon flag, when gameOver is true, tells the game whether the player has won (true) or lost (false).

        • mouseDown

          java.lang.Boolean mouseDown
          Contains a true/false value depending on the state of the left mouse button.

        • mouseX

          int mouseX
          Contains the current x position of the mouse on the screen.

        • mouseY

          int mouseY
          Contains the current y position of the mouse on the screen.

        • activeChains

          int activeChains
          Contains the number of active chains on the screen, including disabled chains.

        • disabledChains

          int disabledChains
          Contains the number of active chains that have been disabled.

        • newLevel

          java.lang.Boolean newLevel
          True if a new level should be transitioned to. False else.

        • level

          int level
          Contains the integer ID of the current level (These are currently: 1, 2, 3, 4)

        • points

          int points
          Contains and integer counting of the current player's point total.

        • highscores

          java.lang.String[] highscores
          Contains a list of even strings, alternating between a player's name and their highscore (as a string)

        • fontsize

          int fontsize
          Contains an often used font size

        • font

          java.awt.Font font
          Contains an often used Font object.

        • fontmetrics

          java.awt.FontMetrics fontmetrics
          Contains an often used FontMeterics.
